gcci.text: At an average H100 price of $3.18/hr, cloud capacity is easing from 2023–2024 peaks, but persistent supply constraints and high capex still give hyperscalers leverage over smaller buyers and push firms to pre-commit to secure priority access.

gtpi.text: With an average input price of $1.25/1M tokens, DeepSeek is intensifying API price wars, compressing margins and forcing providers to differentiate via lower latency, higher context, or on‑prem/offline deployments to defend share.

gagl.text: An annual load of 120 TWh indicates rising grid strain, driving demand for flexible peakers, storage, and a re‑examination of nuclear options to curb carbon intensity as AI workloads expand.

aipi.text: Commodity pricing across compute ($3.18/hr), tokens ($1.25/1M), and energy (120 TWh load) signals rapid normalization and intensified competition; if capex and data center build‑outs outpace efficiency gains, bubble risk rises while sustainable growth depends on unit‑economics discipline.
